Mice were euthanised by perfusion with PBS post anesthesia and tissues were harvested and fixed in 10% neutral buffered formalin, and cut into 5 μm-thick sections for hematoxylin and eosin (H&E) staining
35 . Histopathological examination was carried out in a blinded fashion based on the presence of oedema, inflammation, muscle necrosis, tendonitis, and synovitis in mouse joint. Severity of grading was assigned on the following scale: 1—minimal; 2—mild; 3—moderate, 4—marked & 5—severe as previously described
21 .
